triples.name: Quantum information
triples.relevance: Provides the foundational framework for understanding quantum complexity and quantum systems.

triples.name: Hamiltonian (quantum mechanics)
triples.relevance: Central to the paper's study of time evolution under chaotic Hamiltonians in quantum systems.

triples.name: Sachdev-Ye-Kitaev model
triples.relevance: The main example model used throughout the paper to study quantum complexity in chaotic systems.

triples.name: Geodesic
triples.relevance: Used via the Euler-Arnold formalism to characterize minimal paths for quantum complexity growth.

triples.name: Unitary operator
triples.relevance: Time evolution operators are analyzed as elements on the manifold of unitary operators acting on Hilbert space.

triples.name: Hilbert space
triples.relevance: The mathematical framework in which quantum states and unitary operators are defined.

triples.name: Time evolution
triples.relevance: The core process studied in the paper for understanding how quantum complexity grows over time.

triples.name: Holographic principle
triples.relevance: Provides theoretical justification for expected linear complexity growth in chaotic systems.

triples.name: Integrable system
triples.relevance: Contrasted with chaotic systems; studied with N=2 fermions to show different complexity behavior.

triples.name: Quantum state
triples.relevance: Fundamental entity whose complexity is analyzed under time evolution with Hamiltonian dynamics.

triples.name: Energy eigenstate
triples.relevance: Central to the Eigenstate Complexity Hypothesis which bounds overlaps with offdiagonal projectors.

triples.name: BQP
triples.relevance: Referenced in discussion of computational complexity class separations PSPACE vs BQP/poly.

triples.name: PSPACE
triples.relevance: Computational complexity class referenced in theoretical implications about quantum complexity.

triples.name: Chaos theory
triples.relevance: Studies chaotic Hamiltonians which are expected to show linear complexity growth.

triples.name: Quantum circuit
triples.relevance: Relates to the fast-forwarding of quantum Hamiltonians and implementation of quantum evolution.

triples.name: Eigenstate Complexity Hypothesis
triples.relevance: Novel hypothesis proposed in the paper that bounds overlaps to ensure linear complexity growth.
